sections.title: The Exit Interview
sections.intent: Establish Artie's mundane life and his transition into the broken 'Crit-Only' mechanics.
sections.end_condition: Artie is locked into a 'Crit or Quit' build with 1 HP and 100% Critical Hit rate.

sections.title: The First Spawn
sections.intent: Demonstrate the lethal fragility of the 1 HP build in a hostile environment.
sections.end_condition: Artie is forced to flee the tutorial zone as it aggressively aggros on his anomaly status.

sections.title: The Safe Zone?
sections.intent: Introduce the hub world, its culture of RNG worship, and Artie's first major antagonist.
sections.end_condition: Artie makes a high-level rival in Vane and barely escapes a forced duel.

sections.title: Shopping for Scraps
sections.intent: Equip Artie with the bare minimum gear required to survive a dungeon without taking damage.
sections.end_condition: Artie acquires the 'Cloak of the Cowardly Lion' and looks like a neon yellow cat.

sections.title: The Crypt of Bad Math
sections.intent: Test the Crit-build's resource farming potential in a controlled dungeon crawl.
sections.end_condition: Artie discovers he can turn enemies into loot-filled pinatas via System Overload.

sections.title: The Rival's Shadow
sections.intent: Escalate the tension by showing Vane's power and forcing Artie into a boss encounter.
sections.end_condition: The Bone Golem emerges, initiating a boss battle where Artie is at a massive disadvantage.

sections.title: The Dance of Death
sections.intent: A high-stakes combat sequence where Artie must exploit physics to survive a 'Crit-Resist' boss.
sections.end_condition: The floor collapses, trapping the Bone Golem in a hole.

sections.title: The Final Blow
sections.intent: Resolve the boss fight through a comedic System exploit and secure massive XP.
sections.end_condition: Artie hits Level 10 instantly after the System panics during XP recalculation.

sections.title: Looting the Teacups
sections.intent: Establish deeper world-building regarding 'First Glitches' and escape Vane's pursuit.
sections.end_condition: Artie uses his new speed to outrun Vane's party toward the capital city.

sections.title: The City of Gold and Glitches
sections.intent: Explore the religious reverence for RNG in the capital and the illegality of stat-wiping.
sections.end_condition: Artie accepts that he is stuck with his 1 HP glass cannon build forever.

sections.title: The Underground Market
sections.intent: Introduce the 'Dev-Haters' faction and provide Artie with illegal survival tools.
sections.end_condition: Artie escapes a sentinel raid but is left speaking in binary for an hour.

sections.title: The Arena Invitation
sections.intent: Force Artie into the public spotlight through financial desperation and a high-stakes tournament.
sections.end_condition: Vane sees Artie's name on the tournament roster, setting the stage for the final duel.

sections.title: The Round of 32
sections.intent: Showcase Artie's growing tactical creativity and the System's attempt to nerf him mid-match.
sections.end_condition: Artie moves to the quarter-finals after vacuum-critting his opponent out of the ring.

sections.title: The Mirror Match
sections.intent: Artie faces a high-evasion rogue, forcing him to use unconventional environmental exploits.
sections.end_condition: Artie wins but receives a System warning for 'Unsportsmanlike Exploitation'.

sections.title: The Semi-Finals
sections.intent: Artie overcomes a mechanical handicap ('Inverted Controls') to reach the finals.
sections.end_condition: Vane prepares to use a 'System Override' scroll to rig the final fight.

sections.title: Vane's Ultimate Build
sections.intent: A desperate struggle where Vane's 'Whale' gear and System hacks strip Artie of his defenses.
sections.end_condition: Artie realizes he must target the magic aura of Vane's 'Reflect' buff directly.

sections.title: Breaking the Game
sections.intent: The peak climax where Artie's 'Meta-Crit' crashes the game and he faces the System Administrator.
sections.end_condition: Artie and Fizz teleport to a 'Null-Zone' as the world enters Safe Mode.

sections.title: The Aftermath of the Crash
sections.intent: Establish the immediate consequences of the reality-break and Artie's new status.
sections.end_condition: Artie realizes his HP is no longer 1, but 'NaN' (Not a Number).

sections.title: The New Normal
sections.intent: Show Artie adapting to life as a 'virus' entity within the broken game world.
sections.end_condition: Artie realizes his new immortality is just as annoying as his previous fragility.

sections.title: The Resistance
sections.intent: Introduce the Beta-Tester faction and set up the series-long pursuit of the Admin.
sections.end_condition: Artie accepts the legendary quest to 'Delete the Admin'.

sections.title: The First Step
sections.intent: Conclude the book with a transition toward the next adventure and a comedic final beat.
sections.end_condition: Artie steps into a portal to the Glitch-Woods, hoping for better drop rates.
